docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Although I lost my baby through spontaneous abortion and not elective, I remember that my overwhelming feeling was that I was the only one who mourned her (''After Ending Pregnancy'').
docs.abstract: Catherine Coveney letter on Aug 14 article cites pain of losing baby through spontaneous abortion

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: My husband and I lost a baby during the 18th week of pregnancy (''After Ending Pregnancy''). After the fetal death was discovered, I went to the hospital and my labor was induced. The baby was delivered 24 hours later.
docs.abstract: Ann Kessler letter on Aug 14 article holds pictures of mothers and infants decorating maternity wards are cruel reminders for women hospitalized with miscarriages
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    My husband and I lost a baby during the 18th week of pregnancy (''After Ending Pregnancy''). After the fetal death was discovered, I went to the hospital and my labor was induced. The baby was delivered 24 hours later.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''After Ending Pregnancy, Ripples of Pain'' (Aug. 14): As a 38-year-old (my husband is even older), I was prepared to hear that my unborn child had potential complications. After all, things do happen. But when I went in for my amniocentesis at 17 weeks and learned that I was almost completely without amniotic fluid, I was stunned.
docs.abstract: Melinda Cox letter on Aug 14 article cites pain she and husband experienced when amniocentesis revealed problem that called for terminating pregnancy

docs.lead_paragraph: Baby boys with twin sisters tend to weigh more at birth than their sisters, and also more than twins who are both male. One reason seems to be that having a female twin somehow prolongs the pregnancy, and as a result the boys weigh more at birth than boys born alone or with twin brothers.

headline.main: A Male's Advantage From the Start

docs.abstract: Dr Ruth Loos and colleagues from Center for Human Genetics find boys with twin sisters tend to weigh more at birth than their sisters and than boys born alone or with twin brothers; note having female twin somehow prolongs pregnancy (S)
docs.snippet: Baby boys with twin sisters tend to weigh more at birth than their sisters, and also more than twins who are both male.     One reason seems to be that having a female twin somehow prolongs the pregnancy, and as a result the boys weigh more at birth...

docs.lead_paragraph: If Congress makes it easier for injured patients to sue health insurance companies, lawyers here will be well prepared. In this state, especially in some of its poor rural counties, lawyers have won tens of millions of dollars in jury verdicts against large national companies, including drug manufacturers accused of selling unsafe products. Mississippi has gained a national reputation as a place where consumers fare well in court -- so well that the state has become a magnet for liability lawsuits. Plaintiffs' lawyers see the state courts as a friendly forum, and defense lawyers have learned from experience that it is often better to settle personal injury cases than to take their chances before a jury.
docs.abstract: Lawyers in Mississippi will be well prepared if Congress passes law making it easier for patients to sue health insurance companies because state has become magnet for liability lawsuits and has reputation as place where consumers fare well in court; Mississippi juries have returned at least 19 verdicts of $9 million or more, including five that exceeded $100 million each, since 1995; those representing plaintiffs see state's courts as friendly forum, as place where poor people can hold big corporations liable for reckless behavior that puts higher value on profits than on health and safety; defense lawyers have learned from experience that it is often better to settle personal injury cases than to take chances before Mississippi jury (M)
docs.snippet: If Congress makes it easier for injured patients to sue health insurance companies, lawyers here will be well prepared. In this state, especially in some of its poor rural counties, lawyers have won tens of millions of dollars in jury verdicts...

docs.lead_paragraph: Government health experts have renewed warnings to women not to take the acne medication Accutane during pregnancy because the drug could cause severe birth defects. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said there were more than 2,000 reports of pregnancies exposed to Accutane from 1982 to March last year.

headline.main: New Warning About a Drug In Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention renews warning to women not to take drug Accutane during pregnancy because drug could cause severe birth defects (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: After months of deriding the president as an idiot, Democrats have to face the fact that he is at the very least an idiot savant -- and just possibly a genius. The final proof is The Great Stem Cell Compromise. ''This is way beyond politics,'' said George W. Bush while pondering his verdict. What's more, he told the nation, he had found a solution to please everyone. His plan will at once ''lead to breakthrough therapies and cures'' and do so ''without crossing a fundamental moral line.''

headline.main: Journal; The Genius of George W. Bush

docs.abstract: Frank Rich Op-Ed article assesses Pres Bush's decision on stem cell research, noting that Bush, announcing his compromise position on issue, has seized on stem cell debate to transform him image into that of our philosopher king; asserts that Bush's decision, even as he declared it is 'way beyond politics,' was completely about politics; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: After months of deriding the president as an idiot, Democrats have to face the fact that he is at the very least an idiot savant -- and just possibly a genius.     The final proof is The Great Stem Cell Compromise. ''This is way beyond politics,''...

docs.lead_paragraph: When does a human life begin? Scientists' desire to study human embryonic stem cells has raised this ancient question to new prominence. The Catholic Church says that life begins at fertilization, when egg and sperm unite and that the embryo created from this union has the same rights due any person. Because embryos must be destroyed to generate embryonic stem cells, opponents of the research say it is morally unacceptable.
docs.abstract: Scientists' desire to study human embryonic stem cells is reigniting debate over when human life begins and raising ethical questions not only about use of embryonic tissue for medical research purposes but also the routine destruction of embryos that has been going on for decades at fertility clinics; several religious leaders and scientific experts comment (M)
docs.snippet: When does a human life begin? Scientists' desire to study human embryonic stem cells has raised this ancient question to new prominence.     The Catholic Church says that life begins at fertilization, when egg and sperm unite and that the embryo...

docs.lead_paragraph: The pitch could not be more direct. The intended audience could not be more specific. ''Desire a Son?'' asked an advertisement in recent editions of India Abroad, a weekly newspaper for Indian expatriates in the United States and Canada.

headline.main: Clinics' Pitch to Indian Émigrés: It's a Boy

docs.abstract: Advertisements for techniques to preselect sex of baby or to identify sex of fetus early in pregnancy are being targeted at immigrants from India, where sex-determination tests were outlawed seven years ago in still unsuccessful effort to thwart widespread practice of aborting female fetuses; marketing represents strange twist on usual immigrant tug of war between old customs and new choices, wrinkle being that new freedoms may help perpetuate age-old preference for boys; to be singled out as market for sex-selection procedures distresses many Indian-Americans, and subject is so sensitive that India Abroad newspaper has abruptly dropped all such ads; doctors at clinics in New York City say Indian immigrants, as well as immigrants from elsewhere in Asia, are burgeoning part of clientele for gender-selection procedures (M)
docs.snippet: The pitch could not be more direct. The intended audience could not be more specific.    ''Desire a Son?'' asked an advertisement in recent editions of India Abroad, a weekly newspaper for Indian expatriates in the United States and Canada.
